reviews_data.review_text: My husband and I wish we could give this more stars! Our server Bri was fun and knowledgeable. The food and drinks were delicious. Overall, a great experience. We can't wait to return.

Make reservations def for brunch! Food was good, drinks were pretty good too ‚Ä¶ but the ambiance is beautiful. My only complaint is it seem to take forever for the food to come ‚Ä¶ between this dish and the mussels ordered (not pictured) just took a very long time.

This is arguably one of my favorite places to enjoy good food and great cocktails.  Came in over the weekend and brought in a family member from out of town for the first time.  Krystal and Ciara took great care of us at the bar and suggested new cocktails for us to try.  The bacon wrapped dates and olive tapenade board DID NOT disappoint either!  My only issue was that I arrived too early to enjoy MORE food options on the dinner menu  :)  Empanada's...I'm coming back for you!  Thanks Chef Christa and team for another great experience.
Fantastic small plates!
Great menu and drinks

Great stop for a quick bite and craft cocktail experience! The only thing better than the bacon wrapped dates and French 75 was KoKo! When customer service is at an all-time low it was refreshing to be greeted with a smile. Koko was attentive and knowledgeable. I can't wait to come back!

We enjoyed a really nice dinner at Artisan's Palate last night. It's such a cute place and the service was really great!  Tuesday is half priced wine (by the glass!) so I definitely took advantage of that!  We shared the olives, the meatballs (tip: order extra bread), the short rib sliders, and fries. They were all solid choices‚Äîwould order again!  We wanted to try the empanadas but they were out. Will definitely order next time!  Parking was easy on a Tuesday evening but on weekends it can be difficult when all the businesses are open.
The Catfish & Shrimp was fried just right... ooh the tea was exceptional. The staff presented themselves pleasantly.  I can't wait to return to try something else from the menu.

Happy Birthday to me! Amazing service and experience!!! It is always a treat to come here, especially for brunch :) Elevated, delicious meals and cocktails without being pretentious.  Favorites:  The Paratrooper, Spanish Gin Tonic, olive tapenade board, anything on special for brunch  THANK YOU so much Ciara and Koko.
Great vibes & food! Leah was so friendly & gave great food recommendations. Thanks for making our evening out so special :)

This was an outstanding dining experience! I got to enjoy a wonderful Sunday brunch recently and was overcome by the delicious food and atmosphere. I had the spinach mushroom and Gouda frittata which melted in my mouth and a peach Ginger mimosa that was absolutely divine. There was a live performer and an art gallery and even a secret garden to explore! This is not a place to "grab a bite," it is to be savored and absorbed and have all your senses treated to an array of fulfilling aromas, sounds, textures, and sights. Just when I thought it couldn't get any better, I ordered a coffee with coconut creamer that is locally sourced and was prompted to buy a bag of beans to take home. The servers were kind and accommodating despite an extremely busy day. Kudos to the creators of this gem in NODA.

First time here and we will not be back. We had the absolute worst service I've ever experienced dinning out. We had to ask 3 times for plates. We never got water. We watched our waitress tend to a table 3 times before she ever checked on us and we wanted to order more drinks.

One of my favorite places in NoDa, until this morning at brunch.  Background: I'm a Charlotte native and live in the Renaissance property in NoDa - I have been to Artisans Palate more times than I can count.  This Morning, 11:00AM Reservation for Brunch on my Birthday:  We got here at 11:06 with 2 people in our party that came at 11:15  Ordered a carafe of mimosas, coffee, and a cheese plate (small) at 11:10  Mimosas and coffee comes around 11:45  We order food and another carafe when those came at 11:45  Cheese plate with 3 cheeses (the larger version is 5 - this came at 12:00)  Food (3 BEC croissants, 3 fries, a bowl of grits, and a side of bacon) came at 12:30  Carafe of mimosas came at 12:45 along with the last plate of missing food for someone in our party (another BEC croissant)  My wife asked for the GM - who came over and told us she ‚Äúchecked the cameras‚Äù and that ‚Äúwe came in scattered‚Äù - she then said, that ‚Äúpeople that don't pay their bill? That's a felony‚Äù without ANYONE in our party (we are all working professionals) alluding as much. She then asserted that ‚ÄúI don't care how much money you make.‚Äù My wife is a teacher, as am I.  This was the most embarrassing and ridiculous experience I have ever had at a restaurant, and bless our server who we tipped out in cash because she was a saint.  Poor management will be the death of this place. Sierra is going to make it unbearable and absolutey not worth it to come here. She's been here two months. Might be time to find someone new.  Happy Birthday to me?

Second to none food. Just mouthwatering delicious. Every bite was a new and amazing experience. Highly recommend this place. It binds food and art seamlessly. Bravo. Service was completely on par. Bri thank you for your stellar service. I WILL BE BACK! Christa keep inspiring üôè. LOVEEEEE WHAT YOU HAVE BUILT
Love love love this place. Atmosphere, food, drinks and service are on point. Thank you Bri, you're the best!!!
We came in for dinner after a yoga class. We ordered the salmon board and sliders. The food was excellent and our waitress Bri was wonderful. There was live music on the patio and it was so relaxing.

I just left The Artisan's Palate and could not wait to write a review about my extraordinary experience. The food, the drinks and the ambience were exceptional, but the icing on the cake was our server, Bri!! She truly made our first experience amazing. Bri is truly the quintessential server with the most beautiful attitude, very knowledgeable about the menu and very concerned about our overall satisfaction. We will be back for sure, and will request Bri for another exceptional experience! Iris Hines- Flamer
Bri our server was fantastic! First visit and she guided us perfectly on drinks and menu items. This is a must visit folks! It is Tapas so enjoy there vast offerings of food and drinks!  Ken F.
Gorgeous restaurant and delicious food! Our server Leah was amazing! Would definitely recommend this place?
Great night
Leah was fantastic. Amazing service and will definitely be a repeat customer because of her.

Had a wonderful experience today. Came in after a yoga date and had the avocado toast with goat cheese with the tomato basil soup. Delicious and a beautiful presentation. I added a spiced latte with oat milk and it was perfectly sweetened. My girlfriend and aunt were serviced by the sweetest and most attentive waitress, Leah. She was very helpful and thorough with helping us make alterations regarding my dietary restrictions. Leah was basically the only server with some help from the boss. Thanks for a great dining experience Artisan's Palate ‚ù£Ô∏è Five stars from us!

It's so good I don't even want to tell you how amazing it is because I don't want to share this hidden gem. But here I am posting a review because it's tooooo good not to give credit where credits is due. The food, the flavors, the art, the Cocktails, the team, the Chef...can I give MORE than 5 stars?

The Artisan's Palate is on the top of our list for a date night spot! They have incredible food and drinks which we always enjoy. They host a monthly drag show, and are active in the community which is an extra bonus!  If you have allergies their clean ingredients allow a ton of options for even people with an extensive allergy list.  I had to choose on category  breakfast/lunch/brunch/dinner for the review but I have visited during all of those times, and had a great experience!
Great brunch in a beautiful and relaxing environment. We were 4 people and shared 4 plates: perfect! The salmon board was my fave!

Had an amazing meal there last night. One of many. Just a great experience all around. The atmosphere here is unbeatable in Noda and the food and service match. While you're waiting on your food, take your glass of wine and browse the art gallery in the back, featuring local artists. Shout out to my server, Crystalle, for the recommendations and being on top of it! Thank you! Go here.
Lovely little place. The pork belly was fantastic and I am eternally thankful it was walking distance from my airbnb. My server Briana did a great job as well.
Absolutely delicious. They do a great job noting gluten free options. I'd highly recommend this place. From the coffees and teas to the food, it was great!
Relaxing atmosphere with nice live musician. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable on the menu. Great wine choices. Delicious beef and pulled chicken sliders. Fun s'mores at the table dessert.

Catherine and Bri behind the bar were so kind, knowledgeable, and funny! Catherine was like a magician making all the cocktails and Bri was super personable and made me a mean Frenchie's Do. Along with the service, the food was PHENOMENAL!! The white wine sauce with the mussels was succulent, I had to stop myself from sipping it from the bowl. The pork belly was so tender it melted in my mouth. The cr√®me br√ªl√©e had a strong vanilla taste that I loved and was noticeably super fresh and delicious. The drinks were NEXT LEVEL!! I had The Colonel, a refreshing vodka and basil drink, the Frenchie's Do, a gin, raspberry, and egg white cocktail, and an espresso martini for dessert and I was blown away. The simples and cordials are made in house so everything is super fresh, all the cocktails seem expertly curated, and the techniques used are so unique I have seen nothing like it in Charlotte before. 10 out of 10 recommend!! Will be back again <3
Wonderful servers, great food and the ambiance is amazing!! Definitely will go again!

Had a lovely time here! The garden out back is beautiful. They have gluten free dishes available as well as many vegan options. Prices are a little up there, however it was definitely worth it. Check out there gallery inside when you visit! Great spot that supports local artists!
Food was fantastic and the service great too!  Highly recommend the breakfast sandwich üòã.  Thanks for a great brunch Bri!
Our server Sierra was wonderful. The food was delicious and so were the lattes! The owner Christa is such a sweet person and the space is beautiful. Loved the art. Very eclectic and unique.

*updated comment in response to establishment.*  They were closed on a Thursday Morning when posted hours said they would be open. I waited until about 11:15am, no open door, no sings of life inside. I may re-rate when and if I get a chance to experience the place.
Excellent food and atmosphere, the back garden and art gallery are awesome!
I have eaten brunch a few times at this funky restaurant. It s a warm and welcoming environment . The food and the service were both excellent.

The Artisan's Palate is one of the best, most fun dining experiences I've had in Charlotte in a long time.  The food is excellent and the staff couldn't be better.  The Drag Brunches are the best!  I have rarely seen so many people having so much fun and giving so much positive energy!  And all the proceeds from the Drag Brunches go to support local charities, which makes Artisan's Palate one of the most unique and generous restaurants in Charlotte, NC.  5 stars all around!

Such a wonderful gem in Charlotte! Great food, great drinks all inspired and created by owner Christa! Love the diversity and inclusion by the owner and staff, and extremely women positive business support. Do yourself a favor and visit for their outstanding grilled cheese (among other deliciousness), and cocktails.
Absolutely delicious! Brought a friend from out of town here for brunch, and we had a great time! Live music, great service (Bri was fantastic). Definitely coming back!!

Cute spot for brunch with my best friend! We had bloody marys and the lox board. Great atmosphere and live music with a huge outdoor seating area. Definitely recommend! Our serve Bri was so sweet and gave us good recommendations when she learned it was our first time!
I love this place so much! The vibe & food are amazing. Bri was our server & was the sweetest.

Not only is the place super cute but the food and drinks were so amazing! Most of all, our server Bri was the BEST! She was so attentive, fun, and a joy to talk too. Highly recommend Artisan's Palate.

Excellent food, drinks, service and vibes. Parking lot gets pretty full during the popular Drag Brunch that contributes to charities to support refugees, uplifting people out of generational poverty, women's shelters, breast cancer research and LGBTQIA+ elders, so plan accordingly if you wish to partake and enjoy. After all, they raised over $30k last year and $27k so far this year.  If it's not for you, it's not for you. Leave your bigotry (and selves) at home.
I absolutely love this place. Both the food and cocktails are incredible. Will definitely be going back
Great atmosphere, service, and food!

Great experience every time we go here. Feel bad for the wait staff because the large table in the back is usually occupied by 10 Karen's on weekends.  I have yet to find a better place for shrimp and grits. Wait staff are all stellar people.

If you want to experience the perfect fusion of art and cuisine, then check out the Artisan's Palate.  We came to this restaurant as part of the Tasting Collective's private dining experience.  All of the courses were AMAZING and one of my favorite parts was the wine flight that coordinated with each of the courses.  There was not one single course that I didn't love.  The courses that we had were:  Citrus Shrimp Escabeche, with grilled artichoke, arugula and red onion, Corn Velout√© with butter poached crab, Three Day Pork Belly with blackberry hoisin, five spice fennel, and jicama, Slow Braised Lamb with figs and celery root-palm pur√©e, and Sweet Corn Butter cake with figs and blackberries.  Having a sweet tooth, I loved the dessert course!  All of the servers were very knowledgeable and excellent with suggestions and providing additional information about both food and drinks.  Two additional interesting things that I liked about this restaurant, was the Secret Garden in the outside patio area (you really must go outside if weather permits‚Äîdon't miss it), and the small art gallery located inside the restaurant.  I love how chef/owner Christa Csoka melds art into everything throughout the establishment.  Also available are prints from artists who have had art  exhibited in their gallery.  Everything is very well thought out and I can't wait to go back with friends for brunch.  I hear that they have an amazing Brioche French toast with Bourbon Butter or Maple Syrup!  On a side note, I loved that there is a comfy chair available for nursing mothers in the restaurant‚Äîvery nicely done.

When you just crave everything! vibrating energy from the staff soon as you hit the door which is very rare today. Now, the food is fantastic and well put together. I really enjoyed it all. I must say that pork belly had no hint of fat at all flavor to your gums. Yes, I said it! I'm not a big drinker so they customize my wine flight to my liking.  Yall got to go. Thank me later

Food was incredible! Loved everything we got along with the secret garden, however am frustrated with our service both times we have been. Service was slow, orders were not placed, and we were told a wait time of 10 mins and when we checked after 20 mins, we were told it'd be an additional 40 mins.
The food was so good and loved the mimosas at brunch! Went with girlfriends and the vibes were awesome! A must visit
Nice informal setting with good food in Noda.
Brunch is very over priced at this place ! Food and cocktails are at most average  would definitely recommend link and pin the food and drinks are amazing !  Very fancy and cheaper than this place.

We ran up on this place totally by accident.  I was only interested in getting a coffee but little to my surprise we found a little treat.  We saw the nice patio out front and heard live music.  When we entered we were so moved by the ambience and felt under dressed because we just got done working out. Minutes had gone by before we were greeted and once the hostess arrived she seemed overwhelmed. Her energy triggered ours and ruined our welcoming (hence the 4 star review). Once we seated ourselves at the bar, both bartenders greeted us. Ciara immediately acknowledged us while she was making someone else a cocktail. Water was given to us right away as well. That made a big difference in our energy shift. Ciara's energy was necessary and quickly changed the direction of our experience. Ciara also helped us with choosing drinks and they were tasty. We had two specialty drinks and two mimosas.  Ciara also encouraged us to check out the small art gallery and garden area in the back.  We definitely plan to visit this place again.  We will make reservations next time.

Amazing drinks! Modern space with a farmhouse flare. Very engaging and friendly staff. Delicious food menu with a variety of options. Patio in the front with easy free parking. I definitely will be back. Great experience from beginning to end!
Our waitress, Miss Cocoa, was great and made our brunch so much better. Food was outstanding. Will return!

Great live music! Good food and drinks, nice atmosphere. I'm just not into the boughie lifestyle where you pay $20 for a snack, so I probably won't be a regular, but that's okay, lol. It's actually very tasty and they have good cocktails.

I had a fantastic experience with my first time here today! My friend and I came for the Summer of Love Drag Brunch and loved every minute of it. The food was fantastic! I had the shrimp and grits and the bacon wrapped dates. Everything was absolutely delicious. Great drink options, wonderful space, super kind staff. Will definitely be returning to try more of the menu!
Great discovery for brunch! Relaxed place with live music and definitely good vibes! Great food.
The service is stellar and the gin cocktails are delicious!

Service was good, BUT there was one server (not mine) playing with the entertainment's dog, which was EXTREMELY off-putting. I asked that she NOT bring my food out. Biscuits and gravy was tasty, but temperature was not hot when it was brought out. Also got a grits bowl with an egg scrambled hard with cheddar. Egg was not scrambled hard. Kitchen made another. That egg wasn't scrambled hard, either. *sideeye* Grits were terrible. Not rushing back here, but my server Cameron was AMAZING, hence the 3 stars!
3 words: bacon wrapped dates That is all you need to know.  Now go!!

This was one of the best dining experiences we have ever had, starting with the amazing service from Cameron, to the perfectly prepared dishes. Nothing was groundbreaking but it was all executed perfectly and delicous!

We enjoyed our meal here. We ate in the patio area at the back which is decorated with bright colors and is quaint. The food and cocktails were good but a little overpriced. They had live music that started about 7pm.

I literally accidentally closed my browser app and my whole review deleted, but I came back and rewrote it because I feel that strongly. Definitely get the bacon wrapped dates and you HAVE to try the charcuterie board and cocktails are super unique and delicious but the highlight of our visit was Crystal. I mean. Just the most enthusiastic, empathetic, and charismatic person ever. I hope y'all realize what a gem you have. She took a terrible day to a highlight. You really employ awesome people (shout out to Ezra as well!). Thank you Crystal for being you and for making our day. And for the delicious food!
Great cocktails

I cannot even begin to express how amazing The Artisans Palate is! Of course the food and cocktails are out of this world, but the PEOPLE make it someplace I crave. Sam and Coco in particular are stellar, even remembering what I like after the first time they were my servers! I promise that this will become your regular ‚Äúgo to.‚Äù
The Service is a 5/5 the and the people are so nice and the food is so good. The variety of foods u can get healthy food and treaty food this is the best place I've ever eaten at

I'm glad that they're in the neighborhood and trying to spruce that corner up. Lots of potential, but also a lot of work still needed.  The good: The mussels were solid and the wife liked her cocktail. Waitress was very nice.  The bad: Took 20 min to take our drinks order despite only three tables seated, never received water, mixed drink was served with diet tonic after asking for regular, chicken sliders were cold, and never got our glass of wine. Service overall was slow and inattentive. Comparably priced to places like Ever Andalo, which is fierce competition.  I'll probably go back to give it another shot at some point. The more places we have in the neighborhood, the better. But it really needs a lot of work to stand out in an area with more and more options.
Best grilled cheese in the universe!!

Absolutely incredible! We were road-tripping from NYC to ATL and stopped here during a detour in Charlotte and the food was amazing! We got the olive tapenade platter, the rockin' sliders, and the potato/corn/pepper empanadas and everything was perfectly cooked and tasted so flavorful and delicious. The sliders were by the far the stand out as some of the best burgers we have ever had. We each got a cocktail and they were all so good and quite strong! We polished dinner off with the bread pudding and WOW! We don't even like bread pudding and it was perfection. Cannot recommend this place enough to anyone who is looking for a cozy neighborhood restaurant with an artistic flair that is serving up some truly delectable dishes!!
Delicious food in a cool vibe...chef Christa Csoka is world class.

What a great find! We were only in for wine, but the atmosphere was lovely. I especially loved the back patio. I spent some time chatting with the owner while she described some upcoming events. I can't wait to go back!!!
Hidden gem of Noda

A long overdue review to say how amazing this place is. The drinks are awesome, the food is great, and on top of all that the most amazing friendly inviting staff around. Every drink I've tasted is incredible
The grits with kielbasa for Sunday brunch was delish. Creamy tasty grits were perfection!
Very good food and a rotating local artist exhibit through out the year.

Love this place so much! Enjoyed a great dinner outside, they had plenty of heaters for the winter weather. Amazing cocktails - especially if you enjoy whisk(e)y but have a wide variety. Loved the empanadas and highly recommend. Great place to share a lot of different plates and try different foods.
Took a friend here for lunch and it was a great experience. Friendly staff and great food. The meatballs on a baguette and grilled cheese were tasty!

I've visited The Artisan's Palate for coffee & brunch and it has ALWAYS been a win. Dinner was even BETTER! The Pulled Chicken Sliders are amazing & I believe they make the best mocktail in Charlotte...with Non-alcoholic flavored Tequila! Great service as always.

Came for Sunday brunch at an outside table. They've got tables set up in front and also in the back. If you choose to sit inside, there's plenty of ventilation with one side of the restaurant basically open to the patio.  Tried the brioche French toast and a frittata, along with the curry butternut squash soup. Food was good, but service was slow, unfortunately, once we had our order. It also took a while to get the check.  On the plus side, parking for this Noda-adjacent restaurant is convenient in the lot.

What a freakin' blast we had at The Artisan's Palate a few weekends ago. My partner was in town visiting and we met up with two friends I haven't seen in a while for a fun reunion. TAP gave us such an enjoyable experience!  The Good: pretty much every aspect of our dinner was fantastic. We loved the ambience, in a unique art gallery setting, with live music that started a bit later. Service by Coco was phenomenal - I hope the business owner sees this and knows what an MVP Coco was for us. He dealt with a table full of ADHD adults like a pro, gave great food recommendations, and picked the perfect cocktails for us when our ADHD brains couldn't pick a different cocktail from the sizable menu. Even when the restaurant packed out, Coco remained attentive and never let our glasses go dry. The food and cocktails were all fantastic. We shared multiple tapas and some of the highlights were the bacon wrapped dates and meatballs. The Weekender cocktail was great if you like tequila. We finished with the S'mores dessert which was plenty for 4 of us! It was my partner's first time ever having s'mores and he loved them!  The Meh: nothing for us! As some have noted, it is loud in there, especially when the music starts. It didn't bother us but wanted to point that out as it could bother some.  The Bad: nothing! I can't wait to go back!  As the place is a a smaller restaurant, I'd recommend making reservations. I believe you can choose indoor or outdoor seating. Definitely check out the gallery as they highlight specific artists at different times, too. My favorite combos: food, drink, good company, music, and art‚Ä¶..The Artisan's Palate has it all!
Service, food, and especially cocktails, all 10/10. Highly recommended a trip to Artisan Palate

I was kicked out for trying to work. Not allowed to do work in there past 5pm. Only one table in the entire place! I was sitting at the high top table alone. Bye  I don't appreciate being called a liar! You don't give out menus and nothing was stated about no computer's on the huge table I was at by myself. I had my computer out before I ordered. I asked the sever what kind of soup you had.  It was good 3 hours later. It was handled poorly. Someone should have told me before I ordered. Having been in the restaurant industry for 3 decades a manager should have swung by. None of this happened. I guess you were too busy. Honestly it's not difficult to have a conversation with someone who is obviously doing work before the order was even given. You shouldn't call people liar's either. I had to do work! It wasn't a choice. I encourage you to look at the tape. Absolutely everything I said is the truth.
Good food and drinks, good atmosphere, and good service!

This has easily become one of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte! It's artsy and offers something for everyone, from coffee to cocktails. Their brunch is delicious and they have customizable mimosas. Dinner is great too, but their cocktails are what shine. Every drink I've ordered has been on par with some of the best cocktail bars in the city. They also provide consistently great service as well (shout out to Ciara and Koko!). I would just keep in mind that they do not allow laptops on Saturday afternoons, which does not match what is listed on their website.

I went to the Artisan's Palate for brunch with a friend and it was perfect. Located right at the edge of the Historic Noda neighborhood there was a great atmosphere of art and culture. The restaurant was nice and cozy and with indoor seating as well as shaded outdoor seating. My favorite part was the food. Although there was a seemingly small list of lunch options. I believe each item pack a punch. I ordered the butternut squash soup and shared a salmon board. Both items were awesome. I'll definitely be back and would recommend it to friends and family.
The octopus was terrible but everything else was delightful,. We loved the live music and beverage selections.

We arrived at 10:08am for brunch.  As is written on the menu and website, brunch starts at 10:30.  That's fine, we could get our drinks and wait for the kitchen to open the brunch menu.  We had six people in our party and there were 3 or 4 tables sat when we came in and no one coming in behind us.  We were told by the hostess we could be seated at this one table as long as we could be finished by 11am because of a large reservation scheduled.  None of us had a problem with this as we were anxious to be getting home after a fun weekend in Charlotte.  Our waitress came out promptly and we had waters given to us, ordered our drinks and let her know we wanted to order off the brunch menu and we're obviously fine with waiting until 10:30.  She went ahead and took out food order so she could get it in right at 10:30.  Our drinks came out promptly and then at 10:34 the food started coming out.  By 10:42 all of us had out food except for an order of fries for one of our people.  At 10:47, we were asked by the hostess to move tables.  At this point, the fries had still not arrived and all of us except for the last member to recieve their food had finished eating at this point.  One of our members had already asked for a box for her leftovers.  Once we were moved to the new table, it then took our waitress another 3 minutes to bring out the fries (maybe the kitchen forgot them idk).  By then the table we Had been sitting at had already been cleared and reset.  We then requested a box for a second time for the member trying to box up the leftovers.  Our waitress didn't return until 10:58, without a box, and we were finally able to request our checks.  We received our checks at 11:04 and by the time we left, at 11:09 (again, we could've been gone by 11 if we'd been given our checks more quickly without the table move), the party for whom our original table had been reset had still not arrived and I believe the hostess had made a call to the representative for that party trying to figure out where they were.  We also never received a box at all for leftovers, so food went to waste.  I'm a strong believer in having a bird in hand is far better than two in the bush and find it exceedingly rude to have been asked to move tables before it was even the time we had been told we had until.  None of us were pleased with our experience and none of us will be returning to or recommending this restaurant.  The drink I had (mango mimosa) was tasty and all of the food was in general good, hence the second star, but the hospitality we experienced was lackluster and off-putting re being asked to move tables.  Not receiving a box for food would not itself warrant a poor review, but was one of the straws on the camel's back.

When food meets art!!  What can I say I'm a fan . I frequent here quite often . Now often enough to tell you guys I love their brunch & dinner items .  They are located in Noda area . One thing I love about this place is the owner is a woman . In the words of Beyonc√© we all know women run the world !!  Her name is Christy and she supports a lot of local artist ,she offers a lot of their canvas art work inside near the bar area with great selection of wines . Usually it's also a live band or music of some sort playing which is an extra plus . Oh & please let's not forget about the secret garden out back with pop up fire pits perfect for this now chilly weather . Might I mention this is the perfect spot to to go for a lot of spacious social distancing.  Drum roll pleaseeeee, now to the good part which is the food . Since I have been for both brunch & dinner I will elaborate on the items I had on both occasions . For brunch i opted for the French toast and flavored mimosa I chose the pear mimosa which was extremely delicious. The French toast was scrumptious & not your average French toast like you're usually use to in sliced bread form.  Din din was next level . I chose the thai chicken meatballs they are made with ground chicken, coconut milk, sweet thai chili, ginger, &cilantro. The red wine slow braised short ribs were the truth & the light lol. Never have I had them this way Milanese style Geechie Boy Grits, wine demi-glace, orange gremolata, & local backyard Sprouts arugula. Other items I have also tried here is the rocking sliders on brioche & the duck empanadas.  Man listen all of my dinner items were like a dream come true.  A party ain't a party without an awesome crafted cocktail to wash it all down and they nailed the drinks on the head ! Drinks I tried the Oh Shelia , only because my moms name is Shelia I had to have it & the Paratrooper lately I have found myself in love with bourban based drinks and this one did it for me .  I left here each and every time with a well developed palate for the food & drinks here . I consider this a hidden gem in Noda. Make sure if your in the neighborhood to check them out . One thing I forgot to add be sure to try the s'more board so you can try the s'mores experience outback near the fire pit it was super cool .

The absolute worst service I have ever received. Sat down and waited for literally 20 minutes without anyone coming to ask us for a drink, food, anything. People were seated AFTER US and still got served. Will never come back.
Excellent food and drinks as well as prompt and courteous service
Love this place.  The cocktails / drinks are everything.  I always go in planning to get drinks and leave with one lol üòÇ they are strong and delicious.  The bartender was a delight!
Very cute place. Had a musician and an art gallery. Food was tasty but small.

$82.62 for an asthma attack.  Food is good on its way to great. Will be back. Do not sit in the middle of the bar. They smoke drinks in front of your face.  Coming out of there I smell like I went to a club where they allow smoking, but only smoking spruce. This being done, without proper ventilation, is bad for the health of your employees and customers.  Please rethink this.  Pear salad arrived in a beautiful bowl, was incredible difficult to eat though. Every poke shifted the salad to the other side. Not sure what the word is, clay bowl was sealed and had no grip? Is grip the right word? Was  poking and stabbing trying to pick up some of the salad with the fork and the salad kept shifting around.    All the unintentional sifting, every small ingredient eventually made its way to the bottom of the bowl. Likely not the intended salad experience.  Pork belly was tasty. Pieces were a bit too thick and overpowered the pur√©e. Again an issue with the actual plate (there is a theme here). Trying to cut the pork belly the plate was uneven, something was attached to the bottom of the plate. Feeling around, a heating pad was attached to the bottom of the plate? Very strange and a first. Interesting idea I guess, but should be removed when serving. Otherwise folks go to cut the food and well.. things shift and it's like a plates imagining of an earthquake.  Anywho, food is good. Wait staff was kind. Y'all are doing something special here. Keep up the good parts.
Favorite place in Charlotte they have the best drinks and great service. Great outdoor seating!
great pregame restaurant

Lovely secret garden in the back where one can safely dine with fire pits and blankets, surrounded by muralist artwork and natural vegetation. Wonderful service and a quaint respite from the usual! I highly recommend!

Lovely staff and decor. But if you're looking for good food.. there are much better options. Out of towners always have bad things to say about charlotte food. And I think this definitely adds to the bad rep. Especially if you've been to a big city with good food.  The fries were served late. And the egg and cheese sandwich was very simple. As the avocado toast.  I think the locals come here mainly for the alcohol.
Excellent cocktails
Absolutelynlove everything we've gotten here. Highly recommend for any time of day!
Loved the ambiance there. The art gallery was too cute!! Tge sliders were delicious üòã and the drinks are STONGGGG and well worth it üëåüèø üòÄ

What a fantastic experience! I visited The Artisans Palate for a work party where we filled the long rectangular table in front of the bar. The service was prompt and the food was delicious. Being with such a large group, we had the opportunity to try many of the shared bites on the menu. Among the highlights were the Grilled Octopus, Meatballs, Pork Belly and the Rockin' Sliders. We were all delightfully full and thoroughly lubricated with the great cocktails and drinks. Overall I would highly recommend The Artisans Palate!
Great food and friendly, generous staff.

Stopped by for a quick eat and coffee. Really nice atmosphere, felt very cozy and homey, especially with the holiday decorations. Definitely not a spot with too many food options, but breakfast sandwiches tend to meet most peoples pallets. Prices are in line with expected which was nice.Also interested in the weekly specials such as Friday night flight. Will be back!
Had a brunch, cute place live art, great avo toast.
Great, patient service. Good outdoor and indoor seating. Great coffee and breakfast sandwich.
Great food and drinks
I'm definitely, coming back highly recommend üëå
outside dining was excellent...didn't see the secret garden until afterwards and it looks GREAT !!!
I love this place! It has a really good vibe. Indoor and outdoor seating. Sometimes they'll hold little shows and events.

Went for breakfast/lunch on Saturday around noon. Food was really delicious!! $5 bloody marys were also great. Bacon wrapped dates are a must. Everything we ordered was so good.  Understandably, they are short staffed which made the service very slow. The staff was definitely working super hard and it's not their fault. However, I was disappointed to see the owner or manager (not exactly sure who she was) taking her time putting up some Halloween decorations while there was a restaurant full of people. We were there for 1.5-2hrs and did not see this woman help her staff even one time or check on any tables/customers. Frustrating to see as the other staff were working clearly their butts off the whole time and could have used the help.
Had a wonderful experience at their monthly drag brunch! Food was phenomenal!

Management is incompetent and dismissive of employee concerns and employee morale. Horrible place to work. Jada, seriously - when an employee comes to you with concerns and all you can do is push back with negative criticisms it shows you lack any type of leadership skills. Also, the food is overpriced.

What a delight! We were visiting Charlotte from Raleigh and looked great restaurant that served vegetarian food with outdoor seating. This restaurant was highly rated on Google and it did not disappoint! Are absolute favorite was the smoked salmon board. I am not sure that I have had more delicious salmon in my life. In addition the cocktails were amazing and the waiter was hilarious and attentive. I would definitely come back here on my next visit to Charlotte!

The Artisan's Palate had a unique ambience - with it's art gallery and outdoor garden - it was a great space to meet up with friends and also explore. I was slightly disappointed by their brunch food as I had high hopes for it. I started with a blueberry mimosa which was good, and then followed it with a Chef's Brioche French Toast. While I was promised vanilla egg custard, the dish was more dry and heavy and did not have as much of that creamy layer I was hoping for. I also shared a Smoked Tomato Kale with my friend and it was pretty decent. All in all, I would say this could be a great place for a different meal.
Nice hidden gem in the city. The food was good with a great selection of drinks.

It was ok. Arrived at 545 on a Friday so plenty of outdoor seating empty but labeled reserved. We were placed in a tiny round metal table with uncomfortable chairs under a tent near the future DJ. The wobbly table had too many decorations on it to also hold our plates and drinks so we sat items on the parking lot. The waitress must have been new as she  offered me sides with my entree then came back later and said My meal didn't come with it. She brought me the wrong drink and we had to walk up to the desk to request our check after we sat with empty plates ready to leave for a show. The food was delicious including a cheese plate, salad and sliders. The price tag was rather high for the food, service and setting. Given the strong reviews I had read, I was a bit disappointed. I might be willing to give it one more try in the future. I did enjoy the sweet doggo with his toys sitting near us.  One more thing to add. I appreciate the manager responding and recommending reservations next time. The reason I didn't have a reservation is because your website makes absolutely no mention of reservations or a link to do so online so I interpreted that as none taken as so many places are becoming these days so when we arrived and asked if we had reservations I was disappointed because I would have made them if I had known better.
Friendly staff and nice outdoor space in the back
Cool atmosphere, love the artwork. Food is okay. Don't expect much on their food.
Must you advertise LGBTQ friendly?!

Simplicity at its finest. Delicious ,  fluffy flaky housemade croissant. Limited menu, but this was sooo good. Just wished turkey or chicken patties or sausages would be amazing. So many possible customers don't eat pork ü§î
First time here, coffee was AMAZING, staff was awesome and the place itself is super cute and vibey
We love this place.  Awesome food and drink, and the crowd is awesome too.
Great place for a simple breakfast menu and a beverage.

Everything is tip top here! Christa has a keen eye for attention to detail and it comes through in her flavors and her staff alike. It's easily one of my favorite places ever in Charlotte.The art exhibits are a HUGE treat. Who else is doing it like this in CLT?  And so much amazing outdoor seating! Go try it!
Music was too loud, we couldn't have a conversation inside the restaurant.
Very good food. A little pricy, but it's worth it?
Great atmosphere &  great food

Love, love, love Artisan's Palate! This spot is one of my very favorite places! Their Salmon board makes me do the happy food dance- every.single.time! The owner and staff are top notch and so kind. Can't wait to go back tomorrow morning for my birthday breakfast! ü•∞ü¶Å

Ok!! So, first of all -they - so graciously - reserve this very large table for us after church ‚Äî those of us in the biz know how hectic that can be to serve‚Ä¶. But, they do it well and happily!! The food is delicious and live music is always great in my book!  Highly recommend and tip my hat üòâ to a great staff and service!!! See you soon!

I love Artisan's Palate! They were so kind to welcome our large group during a busy Sunday brunch and did a wonderful job accomodating us. I also love tucking away out back in the secret garden for a glass of wine in the evenings. Great atmosphere, great food, great people! Highly recommend!

This was our first time at Artisans Palate with a large group of about a dozen people. The waitress brought out my food and because I hadn't been there before I didn't know what their French toast looked like. It was in an iron pan on a board so not regular french toast. She also had someone else's meal in her other hand which was not what my husband ordered. So I didn't know she brought out my meal. It is so loud in the restaurant that you can't have a conversation with anyone so I could not hear her when she abruptly asked who ordered the french toast. I told her I couldn't hear her so she literally screamed at the top of her lungs FRENCH TOAST!!!! She was incredibly rude. Later as we were leaving this same waitress told us to get out of the way as we were telling a person in our party bye. Learn some manners!! And customer service!!

Myself and my friend were excited to try this place last night for the first time, we made reservations for 3 at 8:45. I arrive about 10 minutes before and get sat, and that was the extent of our interaction with staff. Around 8:50 my friend shows up and I had still not been greeted by anyone. I wait about 10 more minutes and finally get up to the go the bar and ask one of the servers if someone could bring us some waters. She comes over, takes 2 water orders but informed us that no one told me she was sat. We were there at least 20 min in the middle of the restaurant with multiple servers walked by us and no one stopped to check in on us or ask if we needed anything. Other tables that came after us got sat and immediately helped. My other friend shows up around 9:06 and by 9:10 we still hadn't received our drinks and no one had come back. After about waiting 40 minutes, we get up and leave and decide to go somewhere else.  I've worked food service for years as a server, host, and busser and also understanding the short staff with the pandemic so I don't believe in being rude to staff or making a scene ever. We simply left quietly but I would have like to enjoyed a place where we made reservations.

Judge me all you want but I had the avocado toast. And it was so worth it. All the staff was super sweet. The bacon was definitely worth me breaking my mostly vegan diet. I say you check this place out if you're into good food and good vibes.
Great food and drinks and super friendly staff. The Smoked Salmon plate, and the homemade meatballs are our favorites. The live üé∂ and California vibes make it our go to spot.
The food was delicious
Gre6
Fantastic atmosphere and service!

Drinks are great here, but a bit pricey. Great service from the Bar tenders and staff, but not a huge fan of the Owner. I was sitting in my usual spot at the bar with a friend and was told we need to leave the spot in 30 mins since it is reserved, even though I heard they don't reserved spots at the bar. Seemed very rude and unprofessional in my opinion.
They never get our order right and it's overpriced. Don't bother getting to-go from here.

A restaurant and art gallery located in the popular North Davidson (NoDo) area with craft cocktails, serving locally roasted coffee by Magnolia Coffee, craft beer, unique wines both by the glass, and retail and shareable small plates for dinner. Don't forget to sit in their secret garden. the food is deliciously fresh and the service was warm and friendly.
The salads our group ordered where amazing I'm great portions.
Love the backside patio! Very cute and quaint
Beautiful dishes that we were able to share together among six people. Dishes were small and quite heavily themed. Kind of like Spanish Tapas

Came here for dinner for my mom's birthday and we loved it! We shared the chicken sliders, pork belly, grilled octopus, and fries. Everything was so good, especially the pork belly! Finished with creme brulee and it was delicious!! Really enjoyed the atmosphere of the whole place.
Great for a date night! We love their small plates and wide tequila selection!
Great place, throughly enjoyable time and well worth the detour

This was an amazing breakfast on a perfect day.  Don't miss the "Secret Garden".  The fresh squeezed OJ was delicious.  The shrimp and grits, lip smacking.  Thank you Manager Jada for leading an attentive crew.

Food is delicious! The ambiance is great but the service is painfully awful. We've been here 3 times and all 3 times the service has been disappointing. I waited over 30 minutes for my server to come back to our table so that I can order a drink. We ended up just asking for the check and leaving.

Food and service was fairly quick. Safe and cool environment. Bartender made amazing drinks. Ribs and those potatoes were so complementing it definitely filled me up. Shrimp and grits was the other entre was very tasty and loved grits. Bacon wrapped dates was something new but very good for a something never tried.

This is a very special restaurant.  Not only is the food delicious, the atmosphere very unique,  Local artists Display display and sell their creations.  there are a number of different areas to sit, bar, inside, patio, and a beautiful garden area outback.  The food and cocktails are delicious.  they must try in Charlotte, and the owner is a gem!

My family had Easter Brunch. The food, service, and abiance are great. We had a variety of dishes, all of which were delicious. The menu is diverse with something for all. Food and drinks are reasonably  priced. The restaurant follows covid protocols.Overall a great dining experience and we will return.
Food and drinks are amazing!
Not what I expected.
Very delicious food!!! I love the beautiful scenery inside the restaurant so relaxing and calm!!!

This place has a cool vibe and delicious cafe, cocktails, and food menus. It's the perfect spot for someone who wants to work at a coffee shop in the morning. Internet is reliable. Their brunch is amazing and there's often love music lined up on weekends. Make sure to check out the secret garden out back and the featured artist gallery which rotates each month. Favorite menu items: tomato soup, any breakfast biscuit sandwich, and for a drink - tipsy meyers.
Food is creative and delicious! Underrated cocktail spot

I had an amazing experience at Artisan's Palate on a Saturday evening. The food was perfect. Everything was plated beautifully, cocktails were very tasty, and the menu had lots of great options. The indoor and outdoor areas were both really nice. I sat outside to be extra covid safe and each table had a fire pit next to it. There was also a basket of blankets for guests to use as well. Just very thought-out details that made for a great evening.
Great little spot phenomenal food, atmosphere was amazing we were seated in a gallery with paintings of famous musicians and the team service we experienced was top notch.

Awesome food, drinks and ambiance. I've been here for breakfast, lunch, dinner and for after dinner drinks and always found everything impressive.  Love their creative custom cocktails too.  One of my favorite spots in Noda!  It's truly a hidden gem.

This restaurant is a must!  Don't think about it - just Van Gogh.  All kidding aside, this is one of our favorites in all of Charlotte. The food is fabulous, the people fantastic.  Outdoor dining that will allow you to enjoy the food and the people while giving Covid the finger.
Really good addition to the area.  I've only tried them for breakfast / brunch.  Bacon wrapped figs were really good.
Finally got around to checking this place out and I loved it! I got to sit outside on a really nice night while live music was playing!

One of the best new restaurants in Charlotte!  Whether for breakfast, brunch, or dinner the food at Artisan's Palate is simply incredible. The cocktail and wine program are among the best in town, also. The space itself is unique with a cozy indoor area, outdoor patio (heated when needed), art gallery, and ‚Äúsecret garden‚Äù back patio. Be sure to stop in when there is live music on the patio, too!

Great spot for any time of day and any day of the week!  The service, atmosphere, food and drinks all get 5 stars from me.  Love the featured art and live music on the weekends.  A new favorite spot of mine.
Such a nice place. With the garage door up.... Safe. Great food. Today I had a breakfast sandwich. Chai tea was good.
Service was fair.
Plenty of tasty food and bev to enjoy at this cozy cafe...like this ham n egg breakfast croissant sandwich (served until 4pm)

I had a great experience at The Artisan's Palate when I visited on a weekday for lunch with a friend. The lady who took my order seemed a little short with her responses at first but I think it's because she is trying to provide the customer with speedy service. After I asked her a few questions, she was actually very warm and friendly and offered to make me a custom, dairy free, tea latte since they make all of their syrups in house and apparently, custom drinks are her jam. I also ordered the marinated olives and a smashed avocado on a butter croissant. Everything I had was delicious! My friend had the salmon/lox platter and it was great too. We sat outside and chatted for a couple of hours and no one rushed us out or made us feel uncomfortable staying for a while. Highly recommend checking them out. The place is also very clean and the local art is a nice touch. Always great to see the new exhibits. The bathroom was super clean and organized as well.
Great spot for dates nights! Specially half price wine nights on Tuesday. Found them on Instagram and love the fact that they support local artists!
My new favorite breakfast spot. The people are always friendly and the food is awesome!
Not enforcing masks + one person taking orders when they are busy means waiting 20 minutes. Not the best system.
Great food with great prices especially breakfast/brunch. The bacon dates are amazing and great for any meal time.
Love all the art.  Food was delicious. Staff is super friendly. Will definitely be back!
Enjoyed this place. Nice industrial / modern look, big open space that can be opened up to parking lot with nice weather, nice (tapas style) menu selection, and friendly staff.

I absolutely love this spot! I'm in love with the malted iced coffee. And the food and cocktails are also amazing. The staff is attentive and kind. If you're ever in the neighborhood definitely stop by. They have fresh, delicious pastries and local art for your viewing pleasure. They also have live music on the weekends.

We love The Artisan's Palate. The food and drinks are amazing. Nice wines by the glass and a wonderful selection on the wall to take home. The service was great each time we visited. Our daughter loves the hot chocolate and pastries so that is a win there.

I love it here! I live a few blocks away and it's a regular spot for me. Their cocktails are amazing and they also have great daily drink specials every week. I love their sliders too! I also love supporting local artists while I'm there and have grabbed some prints for my home. Definitely check out their back garden too!

Everything about this place is amazing! I love the concept of the shareable plates so everyone can try a little bit of everything, and it is all amazing. The cocktails are delicious and so unique! The service is unmatched and the art gallery is such a cool concept and a great way to involve the community. I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a fun night out!
Good breakfast sandwiches and cappuccinos

This is such a cute spot in Noda! The coffee is always delicious and they have the cutest secret garden in the back! I've lived in Noda for over a year and just recently found them on Instagram - so happy I found them! 10/10 would recommend!

Very disappointed. Went with a few friends and won't go back. The service was terrible.  Everyone got their food at different times. One of our specialty drinks came out after the food even.  The cheese plates did not have enough cheese for all of us (4) to enjoy a taste. We ordered fries and were told we had to wait an hour and then they never came out.  The shrimp and grits was pretty good but it did not look appetizing in the dish.  The food was expensive and when we got it was okay but nothing special.  The place looked cute but it was not very comfortable inside, a little noisy. We had to find the art display ourselves because no one mentioned it (we only knew there might be art on display from the website mentioning a featured artist) and we were disappointed it was just a room. Just disappointed in the whole experience that was a real let down from what we expected.

Just discovered Artisans and it's our new favorite spot! I saw them reposted on Noda Instagram and had to check them out. We loved their cocktails and outdoor space. We felt super safe and comfortable social distancing. Totally recommend to anyone in Charlotte for a date night!

I live in NoDa and saw a post about The Artisan's Palate in our apartment newsletter! I came by for drinks and had such a great experience! So happy we found this place! And we love that they have plenty of parking! Such a plus!

I live in Plaza Midwood and saw my friends tagging Artisans on Insta so I had to come in! I had the best brunch ever - the baked French toast was insane! I even left with a print from a local artist too! Awesome space for social distancing as well, I felt really safe.  Excited for when live music will be back :)
Very cool place! Cant wait to visit there again!
Fabulous

I visited Artisan's Palate today for a late brunch/lunch. Upon entering I was made aware that the business would prefer me to wear a mask, which made me very happy to see. The staff were wearing masks and were most helpful to explain the way the restaurant worked. You order at the counter and the staff brings you your food and beverages.  There is outside seating in the front, sides and back of the building. The indoor seating is open-air, which is really great during this pandemic. You really should feel at ease dining here.  I had the chocolate croissant & the spinach, mushroom & gouda frittata . Both were delicious. The Bloody Mary was $5 and it was the best one I've had in town.  I can't say enough about supporting local, small businesses right now and I hope anyone reading this will make it a point to get out, safely and do their part! We want authenticity in our neighborhoods so please help support them during this time!

Love this place. Beautiful ambiance and amazing staff. Forward-thinking structure and casually breath-taking presentation make this place a go-to spot for brunch, cocktails, a relaxing glass of wine on either patio, or morning coffee. Definitely will be coming back!

This place is awesome and unique for a date night. The drinks are interesting, and there is a lot to do and see even in the intimate space. The small art gallery is lovely to walk through, and the porch is cozy and well shaded for even a comfortable summer night. There is also a fun game to play behind the bar. The TV displays famous pieces of art and then displays the name. It's a good bit of competition to see who can identify the most pieces.
Cutest place!!
Amazing service!! Very nice and friendly environment.
Such a marvelous experience with great wines for the evening and awesome coffees for the next morning to wake me up! Oh, and the pastries and small plates oh my God‚Ä¶
Cant wait for this place to open back up. Personally I feel that everything from the coffee to the food is superior to what the other coffee shops in Noda have to offer.
Enjoyed vegan empanadas! They have great small & shared plates.
Love the owner and employees, thanks for letting us have DragQueen Bingo there. You rock !!!
Everyone needs to go.
Excellent coffee!
Is

Absolutely loved the food. We went for the dinner service on a Friday night. The prices made sense for the generous portions you received, and they tasted like they should cost $10-15 more. Better than the majority of high end restaurants I've been to in Charlotte.  Atmosphere is cozy but not cramped. It can get loud at times, but we never had to raise our voices to be heard. Service was exceptional as well.  Looking forward to trying out brunch sometime in the future.
Great Food and Drinks.
Awsome place as usual everything in the noda area is top notch

Been here several times now and it's easily my new favorite coffee shop in and around CLT. They also serve small plates and a handful of beers and whiskey. All of this is reasonably priced in comparison to other places in Charlotte. I've seen a very good mix of people come through here: old, young, rich, poor, and all races and ethnic groups. The staff has always been friendly and approachable.

Love this place!  Top notch detail to every aspect of the dinning and drinking experience!  Love the local art touch and fine touches from the food, drinks, decor, art, and ambiance.  Great staff too!üëç

Walked in before dinner service and what did they do? Shared their staff ‚Äúfamily meal‚Äù with me. I also had coffee and later a couple glasses of wine that were well prepared and perfectly paired perspectively. Great service! The small plate menu and cheese menu looks incredible. Can't wait to go back!
Good food and service
Cute spot! Good food and atmosphere! First time to visit for a wedding reception and loved all of it. Nice staff and good drinks. Definitely a brunch place for me! Enjoyed all the gourmet cheeses!!

This place is amazing! The food is the first thing and it is awesome! So many flavors. I'm a foodie and this place is worth it.  Cocktails are creative and delicious and there's a wonderful wine selection too!!  Not to mention she always has the gallery where there is a featured artist with items for sale..... and then there is the garden-- aka the patio with fire pit.  Can't say enough wonderful things about this place.  It's a must when you love or visit Charlotte.

Coffee spot with some baked good items. Kitchen is open for brunch and weekend small plates. Service was great. The last star was not awarded because I felt they were still trying to determine how they fit in the community. Currently, the approach feels like it is trying to over appeal to the counter culture taking away from it's authenticity.
Bakery items were good and my boss enjoyed the espresso latta
This is my new favorite place to get coffee in Charlotte. It's a great venue to work in as well.

Better than average coffees, in house baked goods, and drinks galore. The decor is open and fresh, and quite artsy.  They have a gallery in the back corner for artists and to show their goods and it changes frequently.  The art is for sale as well as prints of the same.  My favorite part was at the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable.  Also, there is an indoor and outdoor section and they have small plates available.

New favorite cafe. Barista is the sweetest ever and the oat milk latte was to absolutely die for! Great study spot but only if you have earphones. Indoor music is a tad loud for deep focused studying. Aesthetic is on point too.

Such an amazing space and concept. Awesome coffee and pastries to start the morning! Recently visited for dinner with some friends, and Christa (the owner) did not disappoint! She has put together a fantastic craft cocktail program and dinner was fabulous! They also have an art gallery featuring local artists. We will definitely be returning, time and time again.
Great place. Very nice people working there. Tasty food and full bar. Cute patio out back. Go check it out!
Great place with classic cocktails and an incredible food menu.  Love that we have a place open to 11:00 in the neighborhood. I will definitely be there on a regular basis.
Get place great people great food.
What a unique place...I absolutely love it here‚ù£ If u r looking for a great place to get a coffee and chill this is it. The price was super reasonable too!!!
Excellent service and great atmosphere, the malted iced coffee is amazing. Can't wait for the full opening in September.

I heard this establishment recently opened and thought to check it . It has everything I expected and then some. I decided to have a Matcha Green Tea Latte.It was very tasty ! After I had my tea, I had an opportunity to meet the a friend employed there and met the owner. They were very pleasent and cheerful. Before I went away , I purchased a couple of baked items such as scones and Struesel cakes. I would highly recommend the Artisan's Palate,as they will be very successful.
